sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
By the King where in a proclamation (lately by vs published) for considerations therein expressed, we prescribed a course whereby the complaints of our people might bee taken away ... England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I) James I, King of England, 1566-1625.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
By Robert Barker, Printer to the Kings most excellent Maiestie, Imprinted at London : Anno Dom. 1603.
Announcing surrender of the patent for tin. Contains historiated initial. "Giuen at our Mannour of Greenwich the 16. day of Iune, in the first yeere of our Reigne of England, France, and Ireland, And in the sixe and thirtieth of Scotland." Reproduction of original in: Society of Antiquaries.
=======

1 sheet ([1] p.).
By Robert Barker, Printer to the Kings most excellent Maiestie, Imprinted at London : Anno Dom. 1603.
Announcing surrender of the patent for tin. Contains historiated initial. "Giuen at our Mannour of Greenwich the 16. day of Iune, in the first yeere of our Reigne of England, France, and Ireland, And in the sixe and thirtieth of Scotland." Reproduction of original in: Society of Antiquaries.
